titlestmt.subtitle: Miscellaneous Items, 1933-1991, related to film at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Amanda Harlan.

profiledesc.creation:
XML finding aid derived from HTML version through cutting and pasting.
[date of source:
Finding aid encoded by Amanda Harlan, Lilly Library, Indiana University, October 5, 2004

change.item: Revisions to encoded finding aid completed.
EADid number changed from inuli-LMCxxxx to InU-Li-VAA1331.
Updated to schema and proofread. ML

titlepage.publisher: Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlepage.p: © 2004 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Summary Information
did.unittitle: Film mss.,
did.abstract: Consists of individual items acquired separately either as a gift, purchase, transfer, or removal from a variety of sources, relating to film. Additions continue to be made.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Received from various sources at various times. Accession information is given with the item entry. The most recent addition was made in 1994.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Film mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Film mss., chiefly 20th century, consist of scripts, letters, photographs, and other materials relating to film and movie productions which have been acquired individually and at various times from various sources.

arrangement.head: Arrangement/Organization
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically. Undated items are arranged alphabetically at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Film mss.

scopecontent.p: Arranged chronologically at the item level, undated items are further arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: 1933[?] - Sketches with shooting instructions for the motion picture Tugboat Annie.

acqinfo.p: Removed from shooting script of Tugboat Annie, Culver City, Calif., Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, 1933 (Lilly PN6120.S42 T915). 1985

did.unittitle: 1935, Dec. 21 - Mr. Zanuck’s notes on "The country doctor."

list.item: Concerns revisions to be made in the filmscript The country doctor; refers to suggestions made by Darryl Francis Zanuck, Nunnally Johnson, and Henry King.

acqinfo.p: Removed from The country doctor: screenplay [Twentieth Century-Fox] 1935, (Lilly PN6120.S42 C8558), dated Dec. 19, 1935, on cover, but with revisions dating to Jan. 17, 1936.

did.unittitle: 1936[?] - [ The Case of the black cat: notes concerning Spanish subtitling].

acqinfo.p: Removed from The Case of the black cat: screen play. Warner Brothers, 1936 (Lilly PN6120.S42 C3374). 1986

did.unittitle: 1938, Apr. 29 - Zimbalist, Sam, 1901-1958, producer. To Richard Thorpe.

list.item: Concerns name changes required by legal department of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer for the film Knockout [i.e. The crowd roars].
Copies sent to Adolph Zimmer and Al Jennings.

acqinfo.p: Removed from film script The crowd roars, Culver City, Calif., Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, 1938 (Lilly PN6120.S42 C953). 1985

did.unittitle: 1938 - [Photographs relating to the motion picture Stagecoach].

list.item: Publicity poses and movie stills of the characters.
Seventeen photographs, with two copies of no. 8.

did.unittitle:
1941, July 3 - Lubitsch, Ernst, 1892-1947, film director, and Menyhért Melchior Lengyel, 1880-1974, playwright.
To be or not to be [film treatment].

list.item: Blue paper wrapper: Property of Walter Wanger Productions, Inc.
Produced and directed by Ernst Lubitsch.

did.unittitle: 1941 - [Photographs relating to the motion picture The Wolf Man].

list.item: Includes publicity poses numbered P.1-P.12, with notes on versos; stills numbered 1-18, 20-22, 24, 26-80, 82-95, some with notes on versos, some of scenes cut from the final version; 1 numbered 18-2; 1 photograph of a page from the pressbook; and 1 other photograph that appears to be from a sequel to The Wolf Man.
Actors prominently featured include Evelyn Ankers, Ralph Bellamy, Lon Chaney, Jr., Patrick Knowles, Bela Lugosi, Maria Ouspenskaya, Claude Rains, and Warren William.

did.unittitle: 1941 - [ Western Union: note concerning footages].

list.item: Pencilled note beginning: "Western Union for B & W New footages for main credits (minus Technicolor credits)."

acqinfo.p: Removed from Carson, Robert. Western Union: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1941 (Lilly PN6120.S42 W527 1941). 1985

did.unittitle: 1947 - [Photographs relating to the motion picture Macbeth].

list.item: 8 black and white movie stills and publicity poses.

did.unittitle: ca. 1947 - “War Party.” Draft screenplay for John Ford’s film Fort Apache. Corrections and insertions throughout.
did.physdesc: in dark brown clamshell box with Fort Apache in gold stamp on spine. T.D., 160 p. 28cm.

did.unittitle: 1949, Nov.-1950, June - An American in Paris (motion picture). Scripts and story line, etc.

list.item: Story and screen play by Alan Jay Lerner.

acqinfo.p: Transfer. Book Dept., Lilly Library, Bloomington, IN. 1994

did.unittitle: 1950, July 19-Aug. 17 - Sister Carrie [filmscript].

list.item: Goetz, based on Theodore Dreiser’s novel Sister Carrie.
Motion picture released as Carrie, produced and directed by William Wyler for Paramount Pictures, inc.
Accompanied by two publicity photographs and cast of characters.

Contents include wardrobe plot preceding each sequence:
Sequence A, 14 p.
Sequence B, 4 p. and snapshot
Sequence C, 10 p.
Sequence D, 2 p.
Sequence E, 4 p.
Sequence F, 6 p.
Sequence G, 4 p.
Sequence H, 16 p.
2 snapshots.

did.unittitle: 1950 - [ Abbott and Costello in the Foreign Legion: note concerning matte shots.]

list.item: With pencilled notation of camera speed.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Abbott and Costello in the Foreign Legion. [Universal Pictures, 1950] (Lilly PN6120.S42 A126). 1985

did.unittitle: ca. 1950 - Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation. [Publicity photographs of actors and actresses.]

list.item: Corners damaged on all photographs and two photographs have numbers written in ink.

Photographs are of:
- Dana Andrews,
- Anne Baxter,
- Dan Dailey,
- Joann [sic] Dru,
- Susan Hayward,
- Jeffrey Hunter,
- Victor Mature,
- Maureen O'Hara,
- Debra Paget,
- Jean Peters,
- Tyrone Power,
- Thema Ritter,
- George Sanders,
- James Stewart,
- Gene Tierney,
- Robert Wagner,
- Clifton Webb,
- Richard Widmark.

did.unittitle: 1953 - The Sun Shines Bright. Argosy Pictures. Directed by John Ford

list.item: To Paul Kohner, 9161 Sunset Blvd., Los Angeles 46, California. Sending the screenplay of Moby Dick by Leopold Atlas, owned by Anthony Mann. Will discuss it later. T.L.S. 1p. 28 cm.
Accompanied by a critique by “I.”, dated 6-11-53, of the screenplay of Moby Dick. (T.D. 1 p. 14 cm.)

acqinfo.p: Removed from Moby Dick: Screenplay by Leopold Atlas. Beverly Hills, MCA, 1953? (Lilly PN6120.S42 M687). 1981

did.unittitle: 1954 - Fellini, Federico, 1920-1993. La Strada. [Screenplay] in Italian.
did.physdesc: with pencil and ink annotations and sketches throughout. In brown wrappers. T.D., 378 p., 26.8cm.

did.unittitle: 1955, Dec. 1 - Selznick, David Oliver, 1902-1965, motion picture producer. Culver City, California. To Darryl Francis Zanuck, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Beverly Hills, California. Concerning Jennifer Jones' role in the motion picture The man in the gray flannel suit.

list.item: Production number 2650 pencilled in upper right corner of first page.
Carbon copy sent to Nunnally Johnson.
Removed from the filmscript The man in the gray flannel suit, Dec. 12, 1955 (Lilly PN6120.S42 M2641).

acqinfo.p: Transferred from Book Department, Lilly Library, 1985

did.unittitle: 1955 - The Long gray line (motion picture) [Film poster].
1955 - The Long gray line. Columbia Pictures. Directed by John Ford.

physdesc.dimensions: Press kits. 16 in. x 12 in. 20p; 12 ½ in. x 18 in. [32] p.

did.unittitle: 1956, May 21 - Marx, Groucho, 1890-1977, comedian. Los Angeles, Calif. To Arnold Brein.
1957, Feb. 14 - Short cut to hell [filmscript].

list.item: Script #123, probably assigned to men’s wardrobe.
Accompanied by 10 p. of male characters’ wardrobe plot, 19 photographs dated Mar. 5, 1957, and mimeographed shooting schedule.

did.unittitle: 1957, May 9 - Marx, Groucho, 1890-1977, comedian, et al. Los Angles, Calif. To Arnold Brein.

list.item: Also signed by Harpo and Chico Marx.
Photographic postcard depicting the three Marx Brothers.

did.unittitle: 1957, May 9 - Marx, Groucho, 1890-1977, comedian. Los Angeles, Calif. To Arnold Brein.
1957, July 25 - Adler, Buddy Maurice, 1908-1960, motion picture producer. To Jerry Wald. Concerning the first draft continuity for the motion picture The Long Hot Summer.

list.item: Annotated in unknown hand in red pencil and ink.
Accompanied by unannotated copy in blue cover.

acqinfo.p: Transferred from Book Department, Lilly Library. 1982

did.unittitle: 1957 - The Rising of the moon (motion picture) [Film poster].
1958, Feb. 5 - Mandaville, Molly. To Buddy Maurice Adler. Concerning names of children in the screenplay for the motion picture The Inn of the sixth happiness.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Lennart, Isobel. The Inn of the sixth happiness: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1958 (Lilly PN6120.S42 I57). 1985

did.unittitle: 1958, Feb. 5 - Mandaville, Molly. To Buddy Maurice Adler. Concerning questions of Isobel Lennart about the foot-binding references in the motion picture The Inn of the sixth happiness.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Lennart, Isobel. The Inn of the sixth happiness: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1958 (Lilly PN6120.S42 I57). 1985

did.unittitle: 1958, Feb. 5 - Mandaville, Molly. To Buddy Maurice Adler. Concerning "the way the 'foot-binding' was handled in the first script" of the motion picture The Inn of the sixth happiness.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Lennart, Isobel. The Inn of the sixth happiness: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1958 (Lilly PN6120.S42 I57). 1985

did.unittitle: 1958 - [ The Defiant Ones: production notes.

list.item: In pencil and pen on yellow lined paper.

acqinfo.p: Removed from The Defiant Ones by Nathan E. Douglas and Harold Jacob Smith. Hollywood, Lomitas Productions, 1958 (Lilly PN6120.S42 D313). 1981

did.unittitle: 1958 - Robson, Mark, 1913-1978, motion picture director. To Buddy Maurice Adler. Commenting on and returning copy of scenes from the script for the motion picture The Inn of the sixth happiness.

list.item: Copy-headed: "Mark Robson's letter to Mr. A."
Enclosed are carbons of p. 75 and 75A of script, p. 75 with a pencilled annotation in shorthand.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Isobel Lennart. The Inn of the sixth happiness: Twentieth Century-Fox, 1958 (Lilly PN6120.S42 I57). 1985

did.unittitle: 1960 - Sergeant Rutledge (motion picture) [Film poster].
1961, Oct. 3 - Foote, Horton, 1916-, writer. To kill a mockingbird; first draft screenplay.

list.item: Front cover has printed note: "Property of Universal-International Pictures, Universal City, California" and holograph note: "Master Copy."

did.unittitle: 1961 - Two rode together (motion picture) [Film poster].
1964, Feb. 12 - Williams, Elmo, 1913-, motion picture producer. Suggested continuity for "Our mother’s house."

list.item: For the motion picture Our mother’s house.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Eleanor Perry. Our mother's house. Twentieth Century Fox, 1964 (Lilly PN6120.S42 O937). 1985

did.unittitle:
1964, Feb. ? - Williams, Elmo, 1913, motion picture producer.
Our mother's house; suggested changes in Eleanor Perry’s first draft screenplay.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Eleanor Perry. Our mother's house. Twentieth Century Fox, 1964 (Lilly PN6120.S42 O937). 1985

did.unittitle: 1964 - Cheyenne autumn (motion picture) [Film poster].
1966 - 7 women (motion picture) [Film poster].

1968, July 1 - Corwin, Norman Lewis, 1910-. 10401 Wellworth Avenue, Los Angeles, California. To William Rea Cagle, Indiana University, [Bloomington, Indiana]. He is sending some photographs and an excerpt from a manuscript in preparation concerning an interview with Sergeĭ Mikkaĭlovich Eisenstein, conducted by Lee Bland, while on a trip around the world as a recipient of the One World Award established in memory of Wendell Willkie.

list.item: Accompanied by a photocopy of an excerpt (pages 109-113) from the manuscript of the interview between Eisenstein and Lee Bland; two photographs of Sergeĭ Eisenstein, Lee Bland and Nicholas Borodin; one photograph of Eisenstein and Bland; a letter from William R. Cagle to Eisenstein, July 11, 1968 (carbon); with negatives of the photographs.

acqinfo.p: Presented to Lilly Library by Norman Corwin. 1968

did.unittitle: 1969, July 25 - Westley, Trudy, film studio official. London. To Duncan G. Cassell. Has just sent the screenplay for The Dubious Patriots for approval; work on the picture has already begun.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Nichols, Peter. Joe Egg: a film script. London: Domino Productions, 1969 (Lilly PN6120.S42 D2735), 1982

did.unittitle: 1969, Oct. 29 - Westley, Trudy, film studio official. London. To George Edward Marshall, Jnr. Has sent the screen play for Joe Egg by Peter Nichols for approval.

acqinfo.p: Removed from Nichols, Peter. Joe Egg: a film script. London: Domino Productions, 1969 (Lilly PN6120.S42 D2735), 1982

did.unittitle: 1986 - [Photographs relating to the motion picture The Masters of disaster.]

list.item: Ten photographs: publicity, production and movie stills.
Accompanied by a printed advertisement and press releases.

did.unittitle: ca. 1986 - Color still from the movie The Untouchables.
1991, Aug. 21 - Pizzo, Angelo. Hickory.

did.physdesc: Autograph. in black ink. 6.25cm x 21.6cm. Attached to sheet 32.4 x 24.2cm.

list.item: In blue cover, with notation: Property of Walter Wanger Productions, Inc.
Story on which motion picture Stagecoach was based.
Story first appeared Colliers, vol. 99 (Apr. 10, 1937): 18-19 (AP2.C7); later collected in Ernest Haycox, By rope and lead, Boston: Little Brown and Co., 1951 (Lilly PS3515. A933 B9).

did.physdesc: Autograph. in red pencil across ½ western union telegram sheet, 12.5cm. x 17cm. Attached to sheet 24.7cm x 22cm.

did.unittitle: n.d. - Photograph of "Hoosier Hop" dance number in Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer film, It's a Great Life, temporarily titled Cotton and Silk, a Duncan sisters' talkie, directed by Sam Wood.

list.item: Identification from label pasted on verso.

did.unittitle:
n.d. - Strick, Joseph, 1923-, motion picture director, and
Fred Haines, screen writer. James Joyce's Ulysses.

list.item: Pages 24 and 25 were not written in this draft.
Pages 51ABCD are typed and inserted between 49 and 50.
Insert 63 is typed and located between 60 and 61.
Play appears to be incomplete or unfinished, ending on numbered page 120.
Accompanied by a typed statement criticizing the screen play On title page: Property of City Film Corporation, … New York, N.Y.
Varies somewhat from the screenplay by Strick and Haines as produced by the Ulysses Film Production Ltd., London, England, in 1967 (Lilly PN6120. S42 U47).
